intro: Acronychia richii, commonly known as the white sand acronychia, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale grey bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by oval, woody fruits containing one or two seeds. Acronychia richii is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its ecological significance includes providing habitat and food for various native fauna.
